useStmt.citReq:
Publications and research reports based on the Higher Ed database must cite it appropriately. The citation should include the following:
. Minnesota Population Center. IPUMS Higher Ed: Version 1.0 [dataset]. Minneapolis, MN: University of Minnesota, 2016. https://doi.org/10.18128/D100.V1.0
The licensing agreement for use of Higher Ed data requires that users supply us with the title and full citation for any publications, research reports, or educational materials making use of the data or documentation. Please add your citation to the IPUMS bibliography: http://bibliography.ipums.org/
useStmt.conditions:
Users of Higher Ed data must agree to abide by the conditions of use. A user's license is valid for one year and may be renewed. Users must agree to the following conditions:
(1) No fees may be charged for use or distribution of the data. All persons are granted a limited license to use these data, but you may not charge a fee for the data if you distribute it to others.
(2) Cite IPUMS appropriately. For information on proper citation, refer to the citation requirement section of this DDI document.
(3) Tell us about any work you do using the IPUMS. Publications, research reports, or presentations making use of Higher Ed should be added to our Bibliography. Continued funding for the IPUMS depends on our ability to show our sponsor agencies that researchers are using the data for productive purposes.
(4) Use it for GOOD -- never for EVIL.
useStmt.disclaimer: The user of the data acknowledges that the original collector of the data, the authorized distributor of the data, and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences based upon such uses.

This extract is a revision of the user's previous extract, ID 4475418.

fileTxt.filePlac: IPUMS, 50 Willey Hall, 225 - 19th Avenue South, Minneapolis, MN 55455

var.name: PERSONID
var.txt:
PERSONID is an identification variable constructed by IPUMS using the reference ID variable (REFID) from the public use files. The original variable identifying individuals uniquely across samples is composed of alpha-numerics, whereas PERSONID used an algorithm to create unique numeric values for each individual. Each digit was expanded to 2 digits. Numeric digits were given a leading zero. For example, the digit 2 would be converted to 02. Letters would be converted by the ordinal of the letter plus ten. For example, A would be converted to 11, B to 12, C to 13 and so on. It is possible to identify individuals in different survey years within the same decade.
IPUMS-SESTAT has set PERSONID as a character string for statistical packages to more easily read in the values.
Users should note that some respondents are interviewed over time, allowing the possibility for longitudinal data analysis. Please see our User Note on Longitudinal Data.
var.codInstr: This is a 18-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: YEAR
var.txt: YEAR gives the year in which the survey was administered.
var.codInstr: This is a 4-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: SAMPLE
var.txt:
SAMPLE is an IPUMS-design sample identification number to distinguish each SESTAT sample uniquely.
The sample coding convention is as follows: the left-most digit (or two digits in 4-digit codes) sequentially numbers each iteration of survey waves beginning in 1993, the second from the right digit identifies SESTAT samples with "0", and non-SESTAT (full survey) samples with "1", and the right-most digit corresponds to the survey type, for example, SDR samples have a last digit of 2.

var.name: SURID
var.txt: SURID identifies the survey for which the respondent was interviewed in this particular survey year.

var.name: GENDER
var.txt: GENDER indicates whether the respondent identified as male or female.

var.name: RACETH
var.txt: RACETH is a recode of the respondent's reported race into public use categories. The specific categories "Asian" and "White" are kept, and other race categories that have fewer cases are grouped into "Under-represented minorities" or "Other".

var.name: BTHUS
var.txt: BTHUS reports whether or not the respondent was born in the United States.

var.name: CTZUSIN
var.txt: CTZUSIN is a binary variable that indicates whether or not the respondent is a US citizen or not. The variable CTZUS gives more detail about whether the respondent is a citizen by birth or by naturalization.

var.name: CTZUS
var.txt: CTZUS reports whether the respondent is a citizen by birth or by naturalization. A similar variable CTZUSIN is a binary variable that indicates whether or not the respondent is a US citizen or not.

catgry.labl: Born in US or US territories

var.name: CHTOT
var.txt: CHTOT is an NSF recode variable describing how many children the respondent lived with as part of his/her family.

var.name: DGRDG
var.labl: Type of highest certificate or degree
var.txt: DGRDG reports the type of the respondent's highest postsecondary degree or certificate.

var.name: NDGMEMG
var.labl: Field of major for highest degree (major group)
var.txt: NDGMEMG categorizes the field of major for the respondent's highest degree into seven broad fields. The variable NDGMED provides this information with a finer level of detail.

catgry.labl: Biological, agricultural and environmental life sciences

var.name: LFSTAT
var.txt: LFSTAT is the respondent's labor force status.
